rooms.description: Open living space with a Scandinavian minimalist style interior featuring exposed wooden beams, neutral color palette and integrated storage solutions. The area serves as an expansive living room that flows into the dining area.
Modern Scandinavian kitchen with clean lines and functional layout including an island for prep work. Designed with ample natural light from skylights and adjacent balcony access.

Spacious master bedroom in the north-eastern corner as per Vastu principles, featuring built-in wardrobes, a private balcony overlooking the garden for fresh air, and large windows to enhance natural light.
Secondary bedroom with adjoining balcony, designed for flexibility in use as guest room or study. Features minimalist Scandinavian design elements like simple furniture and neutral hues.
Functional bathroom integrated near the master bedroom with Vastu-aligned layout ensuring proper alignment with water elements.

Dedicated home office space positioned in a quiet area of the ground floor, designed for productivity and minimal distractions. Scandinavian minimalist features include ample natural light from floor-to-ceiling windows and functional storage solutions.
Private gym with equipment storage and ventilation, designed to maximize space usage and maintain an uncluttered aesthetic in line with Scandinavian design principles.

openings.description: Large double front door providing entry and enhancing natural light flow into the living area. Complies with Vastu norms for positive energy entry.
Balanced window distribution across all rooms to optimize daylight, maintain privacy, and adhere to local building codes.
Spacious balcony attached to each bedroom with railings that meet safety standards and allow for ample ventilation and outdoor views.

levels.additional_notes: The design incorporates Scandinavian minimalism with functionality in mind. Local building norms and Vastu principles have been considered, ensuring proper alignment of rooms, especially the master bedroom in the north-eastern corner and the placement of the entrance on the southern facade.
